text:
Hi, friends!

I have a coding issue that I need help finding. We have some styling coded in on a css file I don't think I have access to. It's part of our branding, so I assume one of our team members added it, but I cannot find it. When I inspect it in Chrome, it's coming from the main.min.css file. Does anyone know where can I find this?
hi, did you try using the template editor?

Hi! Yes, but the styles are definitely coded in, All of the links (incl butons) have padding to the right and a background defined to look like an underline:
`background: linear-gradient(0,#01e499 2px,transparent 0);` 
`padding-right: 1.5rem;`  

I have a test page here: <https://resources.within3.com/test>

The css is pointing to main.min.css - I can see and edit main.css in this same folder, but it doesn't have the above code in it
are you able to find that file in this directory? /39371244304/1617806092742/theme/session_copy/css/main.min.css
Now that I read this url. you may have a copy of a theme and need to modify the main.css under that copy. Is kind of hard to help without looking at it.
<@U01U950KYP2> that totally makes sense! Sadly, the main.css file does not have these styles in it.
